content: Who first said, "I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat"?

The famous quote "I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat" was first said by Winston Churchill. He delivered this speech on May 13, 1940, shortly after he became the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom during World War II. This speech was a rallying cry to the British people, acknowledging the hardships ahead but also expressing determination and resilience in the face of adversity.
